stephovercontent.one: If you do not already have a PRIDE account, create one here.
stephovercontent.two: We have different type of submissions in PRIDE.
stephovercontent.three: The Pride Submission tool allows users to perform the final submission.
stephovercontent.four: Submitted datasets are 'private' by default. They will be available to you and the reviewers if you are logged-in into PRIDE
stephovercontent.five: After the submission, the dataset metadata is validated and different post-processing are applied.

section.title: Submission Tool
section.content: PRIDE Submission Tool enables direct user submissions of protein and peptide identification or quantification data, along with the spectra to PRIDE Archive.

section.title: PRIDE Archive API
section.content: The PRIDE Archive API enables the interaction of PRIDE users with the data programmatically using a Restful API

section.title: PRIDE Utilities
section.content: PRIDE Utilities is a set of libraries and commandline tools for computational proteomics.

section.title: How to Submit data
section.content: How to submit identification and quantification results from proteomics experiments into PRIDE Archive

section.title: How to review data
section.content: How to review private and public experiments in PRIDE Archive

section.title: How to annotate data
section.content: How to annotate the project in PRIDE Archive

section.title: Searching public datasets
section.content: Searching public datasets for reanalysis and reuse in PRIDE Archive
